alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 5:18AM EST until December 19 at 7:36AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Lexington, Richland and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:13 AM EST Saturday the stage was 117.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:13 AM EST Saturday was 117.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 117.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
